claims.object: Process of converting stimuli into electrochemical signals

surface_layer.definition: Sensory transduction is the process by which sensory receptors convert stimuli into electrical signals for transmission by the nervous system.

deep_layer.mechanism: Stimuli alter the permeability of ion channels in sensory receptor membranes, leading to changes in membrane potential and the generation of action potentials.
deep_layer.origin: Sensory transduction occurs at the interface between sensory receptors and the environment.
